title: handkerchief_biting
body:
The act of [[biting]] a [[handkerchief]].

Handkerchief biting is often used to express [[jealous]]y in a comedic or melodramatic fashion. It is most frequently used this way by female characters to show romantic envy and is usually accompanied by [[crying]] or [[streaming tears]], though this is not absolute.

h4. See also
* [[biting]]
* [[handkerchief]]
* [[jealous]]

h4. External links
* "TV Tropes: Biting the Handkerchief":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BitingTheHandkerchief]

title: canada_day
body:
1 July. A federal holiday in [[Canada]] which commemorates the date in 1867 when the first provinces of the modern-day nation were joined in confederation and became a self-governing dominion within the British Empire.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Holidays and Celebrations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada_Day

body:
[i]I made you to be strong and brave. You still have a lot to learn, and you'll probably mess up sometimes. But I know you'll become the hero we need. [/i]

Age: 11
Occupation: Inventor
Origin: Numbani (Africa)

Efi Oladele is an inventor from Numbani with notable achievements in robotics and artificial intelligence, including the creation of [[orisa (overwatch)|Orisa]].

title: type_3_chi-nu
body:
[quote]三式中戦車 チヌ : さんしきちゅうせんしゃ チヌ : San-shiki Chuusensha Chi-Nu[/quote]

A [[World War II|World War II]] Japanese medium [[tank]] developed from the [[Type 97 Chi-Ha]] as a stopgap measure to counter the American [[M4 Sherman]]. It combined the chassis and the suspension of the Type 97 with a new turret armed with a 75mm gun.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Type 3 Chi-Nu":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_3_Chi-Nu
* GuP website: "Type 3 Chi-Nu":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_3s_s10b.html

title: carro_veloce_cv-33
body:
The Carro Veloce CV-33 or L3/33 was a [[tankette|tank]] originally built in 1933 and used by the Italian [[Army]] before and during [[World War II]]. The original CV-33 carried a two-man crew protected by 12 mm of welded armour and was armed with a single 6.5 mm machine gun.

h4. See also

* [[L3 (tank)]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "L3/33":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L3/33
* GuP website: "Carro Veloce CV-33":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_an_cv33.html

title: char_b1
body:
The Char B1 was a French heavy [[tank]] manufactured before [[World War II]], and was a specialized heavy break-through vehicle, originally conceived as a self-propelled gun with a 75 mm howitzer in the hull; later a 47 mm gun in a turret was added, to allow it to function also as a Char de Bataille, a "battle tank" fighting enemy armour, equipping the armoured divisions of the Infantry Arm.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Char B1":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Char_B1
* GuP website: "Char B1 Bis":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_b1bis.html

body:

title: mark_iv_tank
body:
The Mark IV Tank was the fourth iteration of the British heavy tank series during [[World War I]]. It featured major improvements over it's predecessors, particularly in terms of armor, fuel tank arrangement and ease of transportation. It retained the rhomboidal shape and guns mounted in sponsons on either side of the vehicle, but dropped the external steering wheels.

The Mark IV Tank was the most produced British tank of the First World War. It first saw action in June 1917 during the "Battle of Messines":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Messines_(1917), and participated in the first tank versus tank combat against German [[a7v_(tank)|A7Vs]] at the "Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_Villers-Bretonneux.

h4. See also
[[Mark I Tank]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_IV_tank

title: crusader_(tank)
body:
The Tank, Cruiser, Mk VI or A15 Crusader was one of the primary British cruiser [[tank]]s during the early part of [[World War II]]. Over 5,000 tanks were manufactured and they made important contributions to the British victories during the North African Campaign. The Crusader tank would not see active service beyond [[Africa]], but the chassis of the tank was modified to create [[anti-aircraft]], fire support, observation, communication, [[bulldozer]] and recovery vehicle variants.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Crusader tank":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crusader_tank
* GuP website: "Crusader Mk. 3":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_crusader_mk3.html

title: vitamin_(pokemon)
body:
Any of these items found in Pokémon media. A vitamin is a bottle of medicine. They are mostly identical in appearance, except for a change in the color of the label.

* Protein (Taurine)
* Iron (Bromhexine)
* Calcium (Lysozyme)
* Zinc (Chitosan)
* Carbos (Indometacin)
* HP Up (Max Up)
* PP Up (Point Up)
* PP Max (Point Max)

Note: For the Rare Candy, use [[rare_candy]] but [b]don't[/b] use [[vitamin_(pokemon)]]. Technically it's a vitamin too (according to Bulbapedia, see below), but its appearance is widly different. It's a blue wrapped candy.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia article":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Vitamin]

[b][i]Come and See[/i][/b] (Russian: [b]Иди и смотри[/b]) is a 1985 Soviet film by Elem Kilmov.

It follows young Flyora as he joins a Belorussian resistance movement against the Germans during World War II and witnesses the horrors of war.

title: baiken
body:
Character from [[Guilty Gear]] fighting game series.

A female [[samurai]] born in Japan amidst the "Crusades" during which millions of native Japanese people were killed by the Gears, leading to them being declared as an endangered species. During one of these attacks Baiken's parents were killed, she also lost her right arm (which she has since replaced with a [[claw_(weapon)|claw]]) and left eye to the Gears responsible for the death of her parents. From that day forward Baiken swore revenge on the creator of the Gears, known only as "That Man". 

h5. Visual characteristics
Baiken has a [[big_hair|voluminous]] [[pink hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]], a [[scar]] over her missing [[one-eyed|left eye]] and a [[facial tattoo]]. She wears a loose [[white kimono|white]] and [[black kimono|black]] [[multicolored kimono|kimono]] with the sleeves tucked in the sides of a [[kataginu]], showing off her [[large_breasts|large breasts]]. She also wears [[sash]], [[greaves]], [[sandals]], a [[eyepatch]] and a clawed grappling hook for her [[amputee|right arm]]. She has [[red eyes]] and is tipically depicted wielding a [[katana]]. In [[Guilty Gear Xrd]], her kimono is almost unchanged, though she now has a [[black jacket]] that she [[jacket on shoulders|wears on her shoulders]] like a cape.

h4. External links
* "Guilty Gear Wiki: [b]Baiken[/b]":http://guilty-gear.wikia.com/wiki/Baiken

title: rust_(.flow)
body:
Rust is the second playable character of [[.flow]], who is only playable after [[Sabitsuki]] has collected all 24 effects. Appearance-wise, Rust has very subtle differences in comparison to Sabitsuki, such as having paler skin and more pronounced shadows around her clothing and hair.

[spoiler]Rust is heavily implied to be Sabitsuki succumbing to the influence of the [[kaibutsu]], given that the physical damage she takes from them (as Rust cannot use effects) gives her a similar appearance to the red demons, such as [[horns]] and blood across her body ([[blood_on_face|blood on her face]]/[[bloody_clothing|bloody clothing]]) which is supposed to represent actual rust spreading across her. The endings of the game show that Sabitsuki becoming Rust winds up making her an enemy of the Cleaners who (apparently) exist in the real world.[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[.flow]]
* [[list of .flow characters]]
* [[Sabitsuki]]
* [[Madotsuki]]

h4. External links

* "Rust":http://dotflow.wikidot.com/rust at .flow wikidot

title: u-2_dragon_lady
body:
An ultra high-altitude reconnaissance jet airplane, operated by the CIA during the Cold War to spy over the Soviet Union in all-weather, diurnal and nocturnal missions.
It was considered safe from attacks due to its service ceiling. There wasn't any kind of fighter jet or missile able to reach it. In 1960 one of them was shot down over Soviet Airspace.

It can be recognised by its high aspect ratio and huge wingspan (31 m) wich required supports while at ground and during take off. The wings are also classified as straight and tapered.

h4. See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]
* [[SR-71 Blackbird]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Lockheed U-2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_U-2]
** Wikimedia: "U-2":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_U-2]
* USAF Fact Sheet: "U-2":[http://www.af.mil/AboutUs/FactSheets/Display/tabid/224/Article/104560/u-2stu-2s.aspx]

title: secret_base_(pokemon)
body:
ひみつきち [b]Himitsu Kichi[/b] (Japanese), [b]Secret Base[/b] (English)

The Secret Base is a secret area owned by the player in some [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] games. It can be decorated with various accessories, furniture, and dolls.

In the Hoenn games ([i][[pokemon_rse|RSE]][/i] and [i][[pokemon_oras|ORAS]][/i]), the player may build a Secret Base in any of various predefined spots. It may be a cave, a treehouse, or the inside of a shrub.

In the Sinnoh games ([i][[pokemon_dppt|DPPt]][/i]), the player may build a Secret Base by digging a cave in the [[underground (sinnoh)|Underground]].

h4. External links

* https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Secret_Base

title: jussai_no_saikyou_madoushi
body:
[i]Jussai no Saikyou Madoushi[/i] (十歳の最強魔導師, [i]The strongest ten year old magician[/i]) is a 2016-Present webnovel/light novel series by Amano Seiju.  

The series is about a 10 year old girl named Ferris (フェリス Ferisu) who escapes from her life of slavery in a mine. Upon arriving at a town she ends up rescuing a girl of nobility, Alicia (アリシア・グーデンベルト Alicia Guudenberuto), from being kidnapped.  Ferris is taken to Alicia's home to rest, and Alicia's family discovers that Ferris possesses extremely powerful magical potential. To protect Ferris, as well as prevent Ferris from bringing disaster to the world, Alicia's family takes her in.

h4. External links

* "Novel Updates":[http://www.novelupdates.com/series/juu-sai-no-saikyou-madoushi/]

title: momotarou_densetsu
body:
Momotarou Densetsu is a series of games by [[Hudson]] directed by Sakuma Akira with art design by Doi Takayuki that started out as an RPG series in 1987. It was popular enough to spawn several spin-offs and an anime that itself received a further anime spin-off.

It's especially notable for the highly successful spin-off [[Momotarou Dentetsu]], a railway-based digital board game series that has outlived the success of the main series.

The games feature characters inspired by Japanese folk tales and various mythological sources. Each game also almost always have a voyeuristic [[onsen]] or [[bath]] scene "hidden in each game":https://namegepo.nomaki.jp/game_momohuro.html (NSFW) somewhere.

note: not to be confused with [[Momotarou]], the Japanese legend from which Momotarou Densetsu gets its inspiration.

h5. Characters
* [[Momotarou_(momotarou_densetsu)|]]
* [[Yashahime_(momotarou_densetsu)|]]
* [[Ashura_(momoden)|]]

h4. External links
* "Japanese Wikipedia article":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A1%83%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E%E4%BC%9D%E8%AA%AC%E3%82%B7%E3%83%AA%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BA
* "Hudson website":https://web.archive.org/web/20070304172909/http://www.hudson.co.jp/gamenavi/gamedb/index.cgi?board=board_momo&mode=query_series&series=momo (archive)

title: a7v_(tank)
body:
The A7V was the only German tank to see combat in [[World War I]]. It is notable for its boxy shape, with every side featuring a weapons emplacement, being armed with one canon and six machine guns. It had a very high crew requirement at 18, and while it had good road speed it's cross-country capability was poor. Only 20 vehicles were produced, and the tank had little overall impact on the war.

The A7V first saw action on 21 March 1918 at the St. Quentin Canal, and also participated in the first tank versus tank combat against British [[mark_iv_tank|Mark IVs]] at the "Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_Villers-Bretonneux.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A7V

title: prinz_eugen_(cruiser)
body:
Heavy cruiser of the Hipper class (second group). Laid down in 1936, launched in 1938, commissioned in 1940. One of the few major German ship to survive WWII. Handed over to the US after the war, who then used her as part of the atomic bomb testing of Operation Crossroads. Sunk afterward, the wreck was denied scrapping for fear of radioactive steel entering the world market.

h4. See also

* [[Prinz Eugen (kancolle)|]]

title: kidou_senkan_nadesico
body:
A 1996 [[science fiction]] series animated by [[XEBEC]]. The series heavily mixes comedic and dramatic elements, and parodies many of the tropes of real robot anime. [[Mecha]] designs were provided by [[Akitaka Mika]] and [[Gotou Keiji]] served as animation director. Original character designs were provided by [[Kikuchi Michitaka]], who also penned the series' manga adaptation.

The series was followed up by a film, [[Kidou Senkan Nadesico - Prince of Darkness]].

h4. See also

title: paramount_pictures
body:
Paramount Pictures Corporation (commonly known as Paramount Pictures and also known simply as Paramount) is an American film studio.  It is the fifth oldest film studio in the world and the second oldest film studio in the United States.

The distinctively pyramidal Paramount mountain has been the mainstay of the company's production logo since its inception and is the oldest surviving Hollywood film logo.

title: cut_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Iaigiri[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Iai Cut[/i]), [b]Cut[/b] (English)

A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media. Cut can be used in battle to inflict damage. The Japanese name refers to iaido, a martial art.

In the Generations 1–6 of the games, Cut is an HM (hidden machine) move which can be used to cut down small trees that block the player's passage. It is often required to complete these games (except in Hoenn-based games); it can also be used to access optional areas.

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

title: flash_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Flash[/b] (Japanese and English)

A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media. Flash blinds the foe with a bright light, as stated by the in-game description and also sometimes shown in the anime and manga. In the games, Flash decreases the foe's accuracy.

In the Generations 1–6 of the games, Flash may be used to illuminate some dark caves.

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

body:
[b]Denjiha[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Electromagnetic Wave[/i]), [b]Thunder Wave[/b] (English)

A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media, which consists of electric waves used to [[paralysis|paralyze]] the foe.

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

title: solar_beam_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Solar Beam[/b] (Japanese and English)

A powerful Grass-type move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

Solar Beam fires a beam with energy harnessed from the sun.

In the games, it takes two turns—one to charge and another to fire—except if it's used during "harsh sunlight" in which case it can be used in only one turn like most moves.

h4. See also

* [[Energy beam]]
* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

title: attract_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Meromero[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Madly in Love[/i]), [b]Attract[/b] (English)

A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

When a Pokémon uses Attract on another Pokémon of the opposite gender, the target may become infatuated. In the games, an infatuated Pokémon cannot attack 50% of the time.

Attract's battle animation usually involves throwing hearts or making hearts appear on the target Pokémon.

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon moves|List of Pokémon moves]]

An ability of [[Carvanha]], [[Gible]], [[Druddigon]], and their evolutions when applicable, in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

When an attacker hits a Pokémon with Rough Skin, the attacker gets hurt as well.

h4. See also

title: psychic_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Psychicer[/b] (Japanese), [b]Psychic[/b] (English), [b]Seer[/b] (English - TCG translation)

A trainer class in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media which specializes in using Psychic-type Pokémon.

Psychics are often seen levitating their Poké Balls with the power of their minds. They sometimes mention predicting the future or otherwise using psychic powers.

In some games, all Psychics are male (including [i]RGBY[/i], [i]GSC[/i], [i]XY[/i], and [i]LGPE[/i]). In some other games, male and female Psychics are seen.

In [i]XY[/i] and [i]ORAS[/i], there is also the "Brains & Brawn" trainer class, which is a duo formed by a Psychic and a Black Belt.

See [[psychic_(pokemon_move)]] for the move that is also named "Psychic".

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon trainer classes|List of Pokémon trainer classes]]

title: illuminate_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hakkou[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Illuminate[/i]), [b]Illuminate[/b] (English)

An ability in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

Illuminate causes the Pokémon to emit light, as the name suggests. Illuminate has no visible animation in the games, but it has appeared on a few rare occasions in the anime and manga.

In the games, this ability causes more wild Pokémon to appear.

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon abilities|List of Pokémon abilities]]

body:

An ability of [[Slakoth]] and [[Slaking]], and hidden ability of [[Durant]], in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

This ability has a negative effect: a Pokémon with Truant only attacks every second turn, because it spends the other turn "loafing around".

title: levitate_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Fuyuu[/b] (Japanese, meaning [i]Float[/i]), [b]Levitate[/b] (English)

An ability in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media which causes the user to float in the air.

Under normal conditions, a Pokémon with Levitate is unaffected by Ground-type moves, various ground-based moves such as Arena Trap, Spikes, etc. and also the various kinds of terrain. They share these immunities with Flying-type Pokémon.

In many cases, Pokémon that are seen floating in the air are the ones who may have Levitate as their ability: [[Gastly]], [[Koffing]], [[Lunatone]], [[Bronzong]], etc. However, in some cases the Pokémon may or may not have this ability.

There are also some Pokémon that are often seen levitating but can't have this ability in the first place (unless aided by other moves or abilities), such as [[Magnemite]] and [[Metang]].

h4. See also

* [[list of pokemon abilities|List of Pokémon abilities]]

title: historical_american_flag
body:
[[American flag]] designs no longer in use, particularly with thirteen stars arranged circularly.

As new states are incorporated into the US, a star is customarily added to the flag. The last time in which this was done was in July 1960 with the admittance of [[Hawaii]] to the US, and the number of stars on the flag was incremented to 50. From its adoption to the present day, the 50-star version has been used for over 50 years of continuous use, while the 48-star version held for over 47 years from 1912 until 1959. Intentional representations in anime media and illustrations of lower-than-50 stars are not likely to be found, although perhaps could be for those set in the period of the world wars, but there are other historical and colonial US flags, to be seen in the see also section. 

h4. See also
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_the_flag_of_the_United_States

title: tokonoma
body:
A tokonoma, or simply toko, is a built-in recessed space in a Japanese style reception room, in which items for artistic appreciation are displayed. In English, a tokonoma could be called an alcove. The word 'toko' literally means "floor" or "bed"; 'ma' means "space" or "room".

The items usually displayed in a tokonoma are calligraphic or pictorial scrolls and an arrangement of flowers. The pillar on one side of the tokonoma is usually made of wood, specially prepared for the purpose.

h4. See also
* https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/床の間
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokonoma
* https://matome.naver.jp/odai/2132895586466556001
* http://www.presentationzen.com/presentationzen/2009/10/tokonoma-and-the-art-of-the-focal-point.html
* https://www.japanvisitor.com/japan-house-home/tokonoma
* http://japansheartandculture.blogspot.com/2010/06/tokonoma.html

title: gretsch_6120
body:
Hollow body [[electric guitar]] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[Gretsch]] since 1955 in conjuction with Country musician Chet Atkins. This model acquired rapid success in the Rockabilly, Rock n' Roll and Country music scenes, being held by one successful musician to the next, due to this popularity it was then acquired by numerous even-higher profile musicians including [[Eric Clapton]], Pete Townsend of [[The Who]], [[The Beatles]]' [[George Harrison]] and many others, turning it into one of Gretsch's most recognisable models.

Key visual traits of the G6120 include its notably large size compared to more common guitars, four control knobs with one placed at the body's cutaway section, F-holes on its body top and long bridge with either a hard tailpiece of a Bigsby vibrato system.

A vast and wide amount of variations exist of this model to be able to narrow them down to specific versions, from different control configurations and pickups (post #480170) to different fretboard inlays (or no inlays at all), finishes and hardware (post #2323061)

h4. See also
[[Gretsch White Falcon]]
[[Gretsch Super Chet]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: excel
body:
The titular main character of [[Excel Saga]]. She has long blonde hair and green eyes.  Her name comes from the Excel chain of hotels in Japan.

Excel is a member of the organization ACROSS, which is bent on world domination under the leadership of lord [[Ilpalazzo]].  She is initially the only visible active agent, but is eventually joined by [[Hyatt]] and later [[Elgala]].

h4. See also

* [[Menchi]]

title: elgala
body:
A main character of the manga [[Excel Saga]], but absent in the anime adaption.  She has blue eyes and short light violet/purple hair with two shoulder to shoulder blade length curls.  Her name comes from Elgala Hall in Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan.

Elgala is a member of the organization ACROSS, an organization bent on world domination.  She works and lives withs [[Excel]] and [[Hyatt]].

Elgala has a tendency to speak her thoughts out loud, which frequently puts her at odds with Excel, especially since she doesn't think very highly of Excel.

h4. See also

* [[Ilpalazzo]]

title: herb_bundle
body:
Any or all individual specimens or assortments of herbs, flowers, spices, roots, or other plant materials that have been bound together (generally with rope or twine) and hung out to dry.

May often be seen suspended (usually upside-down) from the ceiling, on a wall, along the length of a shelf or doorway, or near a window.

Commonly (but not necessarily) found adorning the interiors of rural households, or within the abodes of alchemists, healers, magicians, witches, et al.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Flowers]]

title: hyatt
body:
A main character of the series [[Excel Saga]].  She has brown eyes and wavy reddish-brown hair that reaches her shoulder blades.  In the anime her hair color was changed to dark blue-purple.  Her name comes from the Hyatt chain of hotels.

Hyatt is a member of the organization ACROSS, an organization bent on world domination.  She works and lives with her senior, [[Excel]].

In the series, Hyatt has a very sickly constitution.  She frequently coughs up blood and even occasionally succumbs to temporary moments of being dead lasting from several minutes to several hours.

h4. See also

* [[Elgala]]
* [[Ilpalazzo]]

title: platypus
body:
A platypus, also known as the duck-billed platypus, is a semi-aquatic [[animal]] native to [[Australia]].  They're carnivores that feed on a diet of insects and small crustaceans.  Platypuses are one of the few mammals that lay eggs.  They're also one of the few mammals that possess venom, with males possessing a spike on their hindleg that can deliver venom.  Their venom is described as excruciatingly painful to humans, but it is not lethal.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - Platypus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platypus]

A polo shirt is a [[collared shirt]] with a placket neckline that normally features three buttons.  These shirts are traditionally short sleeved, but long sleeved versions are also available.  Some of these shirts may feature a [[breast pocket]].

Example: post #1395570

These shirts are frequently not buttoned up all the way, which may conceal the top button (ex: post #1165398).

title: attouteki_yuugi_mugen_souls
body:
An RPG developed by Compile Heart, with character designs done by [[Nanameda Kei]]. The story revolves around [[Chou Chou]] as she seeks world domination, and gameplay involves using her eight personalities as well as creating and developing one's own characters. The game was released in March 2012 in Japan, and was scheduled for a September release in the States but was pushed back to October. The American release is censored to remove a lewd bathing mini-game.

title: number_sign
body:
The [b]#[/b] sign.  Known as the [i]number sign[/i], [i]hash[/i], or in North America the [i]pound sign[/i].  Sometimes also referred to as a "[i]hashtag[/i]" due to its widespread usage in social media metatags.

The symbol has been used for a wide range of purposes, including designating a number (#2, number two), pound weight (2#, two pounds), proofreading mark indicating insert a space, the musical sharp symbol (♯) in typing, and designating social media metatags.

h4. See also

* [[Hashtag]]
* [[Tag group:symbols]]
* "Wikipedia - Number sign":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Number_sign]

title: manaria_friends
body:
[i]Manaria Friends[/i] is a winter 2019 anime that adapts the "Mysteria Academy" or "Manaria Mahou Gakuin" event from the Rage of Bahamut (Shingeki no Bahamut) social game.

Originally announced under the title [i]Rage of Bahamut: Manaria Friends[/i] (shingeki no bahamut manaria friends) in 2015, it ended up being indefinitely delayed and all staff were removed from the project in 2016.  The series was re-announced in 2018 and simply titled [i]Manaria Friends[/i].



h6. Characters

* [[anne_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Anne]]

title: shiraishi_yoshitake
body:
An ex-convict and one of the main characters in [[Golden Kamuy]]. His personality is rather carefree and goofy, and he prefers to sneak his way out of trouble. He broke out of every prison he were in and for that he has became known as the "Escape King". Helps [[Sugimoto Saichi|Sugimoto]] and [[Asirpa]] in their adventures.

h5. Appearance
Shiraishi has [[grey hair|light hair]] which he keeps in a [[buzz cut]] complete with [[long sideburns]] and a small [[goatee|beard]]. He wears a [[purple jacket|purple]] "hanten":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanten (winter jacket). Underneath he wears western style clothes, a [[white shirt]] and a [[black vest]].

h4. See also
* "Wiki page":https://goldenkamuy.fandom.com/wiki/Yoshitake_Shiraishi

title: koito_otonoshin
body:
A [[Golden Kamuy]] character. He is the second in command of [[Imperial Japanese Army|7th Division]] after [[Tsurumi Tokushirou]]. 

h5. Appearance
Koito is a tall, [[dark-skinned male|dark-skinned man]] with [[black hair|dark hair]]. He has his [[parted bangs|side part slicked down to the left]]. His eyes are [[black eyes|black]], thin, and have deep eye bags. He wears a [[beige_jacket|cream-colored]] [[military uniform|uniform]]. Unlike other soldiers, he wields [[saber (weapon)|sword]]. He wears a [[belt]] with a circular [[belt_buckle|buckle]] above his [[jacket]], and [[black pants|dark navy pants]]. His [[military hat|hat]] is similar to most soldier [[kepi|hats]], with a singular line through the [[star (symbol)|star]] in the center. Otonoshin is quick to act and incredibly intelligent, he shows quite a lot of skill in battle. Koito is fluent in "Satsuma Dialect":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kagoshima_dialect, though he usually slips into it when he is too excited or is close to Tsurumi, so [[Tsukishima Hajime|Tsukishima]] has to translate Koito's speech.

h4. See also
* "Wiki page":https://goldenkamuy.fandom.com/wiki/Otonoshin_Koito

body:

For tagging purposes this tag is not intended for carts designed specifically for hauling passengers, for such images use the [[carriage]] tag instead of this tag.

title: akaito
body:
Akaito is basically [[Vocaloid]] [[Kaito (vocaloid)|]], but in a red color scheme instead of his usual blue. 赤 is the kanji for red, which is read as あか (aka).  So a Red Kaito = AKAito.

Said to like peppers (hot, spicy) while Kaito likes ice cream (cold, sweet). Both Akaito and Kaito can also be classified as [[Red Oni]] and [[Blue Oni]] respectively.

h4. See also

* [[Vocaloid]]

title: cherub
body:
An angelic creature called a "putto". Western art depicts them differently from the biblical cherubim (who are eye-covered 4 faced 4 winged things that wield swords covered in flame); in that they are seen as pudgy winged infants or toddlers.

[b]For the purposes of tagging[/b] a winged baby. A Cherub should not to be confused with a [[Cupid]], who is usually depicted like a putto, but is armed with a bow and "love-arrows".

This tag, when alone, assumes the "default" of her fire element. In this form she has [[purple hair]], a [[purple eyes|purple left eye]] and a [[yellow eyes|yellow right eye]]. Her familiars are [[Red Dragon (p&d)|Red Dragon]], [[Meteor Volcano Dragon]], and [[Wangren]].

title: shishunki_bitter_change
body:
Shishunki Bitter Change (思春期ビターチェンジ) is a 2012-Present manga series by Masayoshi, serialized in Comic Polaris.

The series is about a boy named Kimura Yuuta and a girl named Ootsuka Yui who are just about to enter Middle School. Three years ago Yuuta fell from a tree on to Yui and their minds somehow swapped, and since then they've both have had to live as the other while trying to figure out how to get back to their original bodies.

h6. Characters

title: fujimoto_atsuko
body:
h4.Synopsis

An original character by [[Lielos]].

Japanese name: 藤本 敦子 (ふじもと あつこ)

h4."Character Profile":http://soleil-lielos.net/character.html

[[poniko (lielos)|Poniko]]'s best friend. Her height and chest size are larger than Poniko's.  She's easygoing and a natural airhead.  A clumsy girl.

Her basic setting ... is that she's a high school girl.  She's not very good at sports, poor at studying.  She a member of the Track & Field Club in order to hang out with Poniko. (Pixiv Club in a parallel world)  Although larger than Poniko, she doesn't have much of a chest, but she doesn't mind.  Her full name is Fujimoto Atsuko

She's mainly shown as a high school girl (blazer, gym clothes), or in a hat and white dress.  White dresses monopolize her personal preference especially since Poniko doesn't wear hats on account her hairstyle. Otherwise, although not as much as Poniko, she is shown with various appearances.

h5.Note

She is tagged as 敦子さん (Atsuko-san) on Pixiv.

h4. See also

* [[Lielos]]
* [[poniko (lielos)|Poniko]]

title: talisman_(ace_combat)
body:
Talisman callsign Garuda 1, is an Emmerian fighter pilot and flight lead of the Republic of Emmeria Air Force's Garuda Team with [[Marcus Lampert]] as his wingman. He is the player character in [[ace_combat_6|Ace Combat 6: Fires of Liberation]]

A cunning and deadly pilot, Talisman was an indispensable asset that greatly affected the outcome of the Emmeria-Estovakia War. He was renowned for his excellent service record and leadership skills. His accomplishments include destroying the [[P-1112 Aigaion]], the Chandelier railgun, playing a vital role in "freeing the capital of Emmeria":[https://acecombat.fandom.com/wiki/Operation_Free_Gracemeria], and shooting down the majority of Strigon Team, as well as their leader Ilya Pasternak, who was piloting a [[CFA-44 Nosferatu]].

Those who flew with Talisman during his countless victories often spoke of how it felt as if they were under the protection of some mysterious force while flying with him. Additionally, Talisman also became regarded as a national hero to the Emmerian people.

h4. See also
* "Talisman on Ace Combat wiki":[https://acecombat.fandom.com/wiki/Talisman]

title: gertrud_barkhorn
body:
Gertrud Barkhorn (ゲルトルート・バルクホルン, Gerutorūto Barukuhorun?) is a witch of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from [[Karlsland]]. Some call her by the pet name of Trude (トゥルーデ, Turūde). Her familiar is the German Shorthair Pointer.

A calm, cool and collected realist, Gertrud always tries to conduct herself in a rational manner. But since deep down she is a hot-blooded person, there are also times when her emotions get too worked up and she loses sight of her surroundings. She believes that a military member should abide by discipline and rules, but still doesn't seem to try to impose that much on anyone other than Flying Officer [[Erica Hartmann|Hartmann]].

Gertrud's inherent magic is called Superhuman Strength <Super Physical Strengthening> (怪力 <超身体強化>, Kairiki <Chō-shintai Kyōka>) Classified in telekinesis-lineage, it far exceeds the Body Strengthening (肉体強化, Nikutai Kyōka) - one of the basic abilities of a Witch - in capacity and sustainability.

She is based on "Gerhard Barkhorn":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerhard_Barkhorn; like Gertrud, he was the #2 ranked flying ace of World War II.  

h4. Equipment

* [[MG42]]
* MG131
* MG151 

h4. See also

* [[Strike Witches]]
other_names: ゲルトルート・バルクホルン

title: gretsch_white_falcon
body:
Hollow body [[electric guitar]] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[Gretsch]] since 1955. Originally made as only a showpiece to display the craftmanship of the brand during the 1954 NAMM show (described as [i]"the world’s largest trade-only event for the music products, pro audio and event tech industry"[/i]), the White Falcon attracted such attention and popular during the event that it was subsequently put into production and sold the following year as model number 6136, becoming one of Gretsch's most popular models ever since.
It shares its popularity between Rockabily and Country musicians with its contemporary the [[Gretsch 6120]] with one of its notably different owners being Neil Young.

While there is a wide amount of variations of the While Falcon that have spanned over its long run (including signature editions), its design as a whole remains relatively the same: White finish, gold pickguard with a [[falcon]] engraved onto it, gold hardware, block inlays, V-shaped headstock, F-shaped holes and a "[[Cadillac]] G" tailpiece (some models replace this with a Bigsby vibrato system).
Notable configuration variations include diferent controls and arrangements similar to the 6120's variations, double-cutaway body and the aforementioned Bigsby system.

h4. See also
[[Gretsch Super Chet]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: nene_(yatagarasu)
body:
Nene appears to be a red light district courtesan, but she is in fact a bodyguard and professional killer. She was taught the assassination arts after being abandoned on the mainland as a child. It is rumored that she once belonged to an organization that dealt with the mainland Emperor and commissioned officers of the Japanese army and came to Japan through that connection.

Nene is fiercely protective of her territory, and on hearing that the red light district is to be demolished, sets about beating down suspicious characters as soon as she finds them.

[i]“So tell me… how do you feel right now? C’mon, you can tell me. Does it hurt? Tee hee hee!”[/i]

h4. See also

title: azure_(yatagarasu)
body:
Known as the “Merciful Maniac”, Azure is half-English and half Arabian by descent. A student majoring in Astronomy, he lost his family and country when the conflict broke out. He is pursuing a belief that physical matter, emotions, and even religious faith can be boiled down to mathematical equations. His intent is to bring his theories into practice by combining Shinto rituals that are imbued with divine power and mathematics to bring his deceased mother back to life.

He travelled to Japan after learning about the world through his study of alchemy. On visiting the ninja settlement of Koka to study pharmacy, he was impressed by the ninja who stoically train for their sworn master and to carry out their missions.

“Man sakata sarima. [i]You will achieve the wisdom of the silence. Say your prayers.[/i]”

h4. See also

* [[yatagarasu (game)|Yatagarasu]]

title: qadl
body:
Qadl was once a singer and dancer with deep love of poetry and wine, but fell into deep depression when her husband and children were lost in the civil war. Wandering in despair, she came to a village called Faraguit (“The Hidden Gardens”) which belonged to an organization of assassins called “Bahrain’s Long Winter” and was a training camp for assassins. Now her four limbs have become weapons that she is able to stretch and retract at will. Now, in these troubled times, she has arrived in Japan to assassinate Aja Salisbury.
[i]
“Tell me, isn’t my honey delicious? Doesn’t it take you back to when you were born?”[/i]

title: cassowary
body:
Latin: [i]Casuarius sp.[/i]
Japanese: ヒクイドリ [i]hikuidori[/i]

Cassowaries are ratites (flightless birds without a keel on their sternum bone, a group which includes the emu, ostriches, kiwi, and the extinct moas and elephant birds) native to the tropical forests of New Guinea, northeastern Australia and similar regions. There are three extant species.

Identify cassowaries by the prominent bony casque (crest), fluffy body covered in dark hair-like feathers, large strong legs, and bare, typically blue, head and neck. The beak and legs are usually grey. The Northern cassowary has a yellow-orange neck and blue head, while the Southern cassowary has a red wattle extending low on its blue neck. The flightless wings are typically not visible.

The Southern cassowary is the third-tallest and second-heaviest living bird, smaller only than the ostrich and emu.

Cassowaries feed mainly on fruit, although all species are omnivorous and will take a range of other plant food, invertebrates, and small vertebrates. Though wary of humans, when provoked they are capable of inflicting serious injuries, including fatal, to both dogs and people. It has been labeled "the world's most dangerous bird."

h4. See also
* [[Southern cassowary]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

Other mechanisms are also possible, such as an electrolaser that uses a laser to form an electrically conductive channel through the air and then sends a large electrical charge down that channel a split second later that hits and damages the target.

body:
h4.Synopsis

An original character by [[Lielos]].

Japanese name: ポニ子さん / 赤星 優奈 (あかぼし ここな)

h4."Character Profile":http://soleil-lielos.net/character.html

The poster girl of Lielos' website.  Has a small stature and tiny breasts.  Can occasionally be tsundere.

Her basic setting ... is that she's a high school girl.  She's good at sports, normal at studying.  Seems like she's in the Track & Field Club. (Pixiv Club in a parallel world)  Poniko is a nickname she's called by her friends, but her real name is Akaboshi Kokona.

She's mainly shown as a high school girl (blazer, gym clothes, swimsuit, etc.), or a Bashamichi waitress (patterned hakama).  Otherwise, Lielos' site deals mostly in maids, mikos, and China-girls, etc., so that's mostly what she is shown in.

h5.Note

For the character from [[Yume Nikki]], see [[Poniko]].
She is tagged as ポニ子さん (Poniko-san) on Pixiv to avoid confusion.

title: southern_cassowary
body:
Latin: [i]Casuarius casuarius[/i]

The Southern cassowary has stiff, bristly black plumage, a blue face and neck and two long red wattles hanging down around its throat. A 5-6.7" horn-like brown crest sits atop the head. The three-toed feet are thick and powerful, equipped with a lethal dagger-like claw up to 4.7" on the inner toe. 

The Southern cassowary is the largest cassowary and is tied for second-largest bird on the planet.

h4. See also
* [[Cassowary]]

title: chiriakuta
body:
Chiriakuta does not know how he came to be, how long he has existed, or what his purpose is. His cravings know no bounds and he absorbs whatever comes into reach. He creeps around, seeking to capture the ‘Black Beast’, a calling that was born from nothing. He toys with his opponents using moves derived from the baseless chaos.

[i]"I eaaaat alllllll. Givvvvve meeeee morrrrrrrre.”[/i]

h4. See also

title: kazama_kotaro_(yatagarasu)
body:
Kotaro came to Tokyo to study to become an operetta singer. She dreams of becoming a worldwide star and to make the world a happier place with her singing and dancing. She is always practicing her dramatic delivery and sometimes tried out other accents. She can be haughty, but is gentle at heart and quick to help out people in need. When fighting, her agility and speedy fighting techniques barely give her opponents time to breathe.

[i]“Do sing and dance allay our woes, for here we face our curtain close. That promise which binds you and me: to end our parts but merrily. (Oh, yeah! Totally nailed it!)”[/i]

Voiced by [[Uchida Maaya]].

title: aja_salisbury
body:
Hails from England. Aja was an intelligence operative for the Conservative Party and undertook dirty work to protect to protect old traditions. After a radical party called Order of the Blue Flower rose to prominence, representatives of the Conservative Party fell from power one after another. Having nowhere else to go, Aja fled to England’s military ally, Japan.

However, even in exile, she was unable to escape her political ties, having lost all faith in the world, she thought abandon dreams for her own life and live only as a hired assassin, but through a certain incident she came to wish for world reformation.

[i]“My country is now on the path to self-destruction. But I’ll put an end to this scourge.”[/i]

title: chrollo_lucilfer
body:
Character from [i][[Hunter x Hunter]][/i] and the main antagonist of the [i]Yorknew City[/i] arc.

The leader and member #0 of the [i]Phantom Troupe[/i], an infamous gang of thieves with class A bounties. Chrollo is calm, intelligent, and charismatic, as he seems to be a born leader and able to hold the Phantom Troupe together despite the volatile personalities of its members. Very little is known about Chrollo's past except that he is originated from Meteor City, a junkyard city inhabited by outcasts. People who live there do not exist in any official records and the existence of the city itself is known to a very few people. 

h5. Visual Characteristics
Chrollo is a young man with [[black hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. Two of his distinguishing features are his cross-shaped [[tattoo]] on his [[facial_tattoo|forehead]] and a pair of orb-shaped [[earrings]]. He is usually seen wearing a [[black_coat|dark]] [[fur_collar|fur-collared]] leather and fur [[trench coat]] that is [[open_coat|unbuttoned]], while the coat is [[cross_print|imprinted]] with the golden [[inverted_cross|St. Peter's Cross]] on the back.

h4. See also
* "[b]Chrollo Lucilfer[/b] on Hunter x Hunter Wiki":http://hunterxhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Chrollo_Lucilfer

title: hikushibe_aya
body:
h4.Synopsis

An original character by [[Lielos]].

Japanese name: 比櫛部 彩 （ひくしべ あや）

h4."Character Profile":http://soleil-lielos.net/character.html

Her full name is Hikushibe Aya. She's a year junior to Poniko and Atsuko.  However, she has a more dignified style than either of them.  

Her basic setting ... is that she's a high school girl.  She's physically weak, but she can study quite a lot.  She's a member of the Pixiv club. (In the world where Poniko and others are in the Track and Field Club, she's not in the Pixiv Club, but the the Cultural Club)  She's more of a solid person and an adult than Poniko and others. But, it seems like she slipped up somewhere on the somewhat deceptive form when becoming a member of the Pixiv Club.

She's mainly shown as a high school girl (blazer).  With the exception of her Pixiv Club appearances, she hopes to be shown a lot more.

h4. See also

* [[Lielos]]
* [[poniko (lielos)|Poniko]]

title: sakamoto_miko
body:
h4.Synopsis

An original character by [[Lielos]].

Japanese name: 坂本 美子 （さかもと みこ）

h4."Character Profile":http://soleil-lielos.net/character.html

Her basic setting ... is that she's a junior high student.  Since she's a junior high student, her height and chest are within parameters.  She's the type that does things at her own pace.

She's a Yamato Nadeshiko that helps out as a miko around the family home.  She learned how to write neatly from "Nippen":http://www.gakubun.co.jp/miko.html.  Because she began to solicit Nippen (rather than just promote it), she was soon called "Nippen no Miko-chan" by her friends.

Full Name: Sakamoto Miko (She was renamed since her old name was so terrible.  I borrowed her last name from a certain eyepatch wearing character lol)

She's mainly shown as ... a junior high school girl (jumper), or as a miko.  Although a different school year than Poniko and friends, she still seems to know them.

Note 1: When I first drew her, I pictured my own recollection of junior high, though it's different from the children seen nowadays.

Note 2: The setting of helping out as a miko around the family home is the same as Lucky Star, but at the time that I thought of this setting, I had not seen Lucky Star so I didn't know.

h4. See also

* [[Lielos]]
* [[poniko (lielos)|Poniko]]

title: kuribayashi_shino
body:
栗林 志乃（くりばやし しの）

Character from [[Gate - Jieitai ka no chi Nite Kaku Tatakaeri]].

24 years old. Sergeant First Class of the Ground Self-Defence Force. One of the female members of the Third Recon Team. 

Her appearance in the manga is very rough, gritty, somewhat muscular. This was changed in the anime making her short, petite and rather stereotypically "cute." In both though she is somewhat short with relatively large breasts. She also has a martial arts emblem. 

In the manga, Shino is hot-headed, violent, prone to outbursts, destructive, impulsive and dull, if not just stupid. She ignores orders, berates those around her, acts on emotions, and also physically attacks those she doesn't like, creating multiple situations that should result in her court martial and possible execution, but she always escapes repercussions.

title: stonehenge
body:
A prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, [[England]] consisting of a ring of large standing stones surrounding a horseshoe-shaped formation of even larger standing stones. It is aligned in such a way where light from the rising sun of the summer solstice falls in a direct line from one particular stone outside the outer circle to the very center and vice-versa during the setting sun of the winter solstice. Archaeologists firmly believe it was built between 3000 and 2500 BC, but beyond that there is continuing debate over the many theories of how and why it was constructed. Many myths about its building and purpose also exist.

h4. See also

* [[Stonehenge turret network ]]
* "Wikipedia - Stonehenge":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonehenge]

title: cable_divider
body:
Either: a jacket around two or more cables which (in the initial state) adhere to each other on one site of the divider and are separated on the other one. So, the divider provides protection against unwanted separation of the undivided part of the cables, preventing cable salad. You often can move the divider along the cables to extend the length of the separated cables (the divider divides the adhering cables) or to join the separated cables earlier (which is not intended since the divider then doesn't provide protection for the undivided part of the cables!).

Or: a connector with one cable contact at one site and two or more cable contacts at the other side.

For instance, cable dividers are used for headphones, earphones, earbuds (TRS connector, aka, audio jack) and things you connect to your TV (RCA connector, aka, cinch).

h4. See also

* [[Cable]]
* [[Earbuds]]
* [[Earphones]]
* [[Headphones]]

One of the most famous ships of the line is [[HMS Victory]], which was Admiral Nelson's flagship at the Battle of Trafalgar.

title: shokei_shoujo_no_virgin_road
body:
Shokei Shoujo no Virgin Road (English title: The Executioner and Her Way of Life, originally named: Virgin Road) is a 2019-Present yuri fantasy light novel series by Satou Mato and illustrated by [[Nilitsu]].  An anime adaptation was announced in January, 2021.

The series revolves around Menou, a young executioner, whose job is to exterminate the wanders known as "Lost Ones" who have come from a distant world known as "Japan" and who bring about calamity.  Menou one day meets the "Lost One" known as Akari and attempts to carry out her duty, only to discovery that it is impossible to kill her.  Menou ends up setting off on a journey with Akari with the initial goal of overcoming Akari's immortality.

h5. Characters

* [[Menou_(virgin_road)|]]
* [[Tokitou Akari]]
* [[Momo_(virgin_road)|]]
* [[Ashuna Grisarika]]

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - The Executioner and Her Way of Life":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Executioner_and_Her_Way_of_Life]

title: king_randor
body:
A character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] franchise. He first appeared in the original cartoon from the 1980s.

[b]King Randor[/b] is the good, wise and noble ruler of planet Eternia and father of [[Prince Adam]] and [[Adora (she-ra)|Princess Adora]] ([[She-Ra]]). His wife is [[Marlena Glenn]], a woman from planet Earth.

title: prince_adam
body:
A character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] franchise. He first appeared in the original cartoon from the 80s.

[b]Prince Adam[/b] is the son of [[King Randor]], ruler of planet Eternia. Adam is a seemingly good hearted but careless and worry free prince in the eyes of the Eternian court. Most notably his father and [[Teela]], the captain of the Royal Guard and his personal bodyguard, perceive him as a simple and lazy coward. 

This common misperception of Prince Adam is because [spoiler]whenever trouble arises on Eternia, Adam makes a timely exit so that he can secretly use his [[Sword of Power]] to transform into [[He-Man]], the most powerful man in the universe, to defeat whatever enemy is threatening the Eternian throne or [[Castle Grayskull]]. 

Adam's mother is [[marlena_glenn|Queen Marlena]] and his twin sister is [[Adora (she-ra)|Princess Adora]], the real identity of [[She-Ra]].

title: she-ra
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. She first appeared as main protagonist of the second cartoon series [i]She-Ra: Princess of Power[/i] in 1985.

[b]She-Ra[/b] is an heroic warrior who fights to liberate planet Etheria from the clutches of the evil [[Hordak]] and his forces. 

She is the most powerful woman in the universe. [spoiler]She-Ra is actually the alter-ego of [[Adora (she-ra)|Princess Adora]], the twin sister of [[He-Man]]/[[Prince Adam]]. She transforms thanks to the magical powers of her ancient [[Sword of Protection]].

title: adora_(she-ra)
body: A fictional female character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. She first appeared in the second cartoon series [[She-Ra Princess of Power|She-Ra: Princess of Power]] in 1985.

title: axelay
body:
[i][b]Axelay[/b][/i] (アクスレイ, [i]Akusurei[/i]) is a 1992 Japanese scrolling shooter [[video game]] developed and published by [[Konami]] of Japan for the [[Super Famicom]] [[game console]]. 

The game was released on September 11, 1992 in Japan, later in that month in North America for the [[Super Nintendo]], and the following year in Europe. 

Axelay is a [[science fiction]] game in the same vein as other Konami titles such as [[salamander_(game)|Salamander]] and [[Gradius]]. The game tells the story of the [[D-117 Axelay]], and advanced and powerful [[starfighter]] used by a humanoid race to fight an evil massive [[alien]] armada. 

It features both horizontal and vertically scrolling levels and allows the player to choose 3 different weapon-types, which increase in number as they progress through the game.

Axelay was programmed by Ueda Hideo. Ishida Kazuhiko, credited with "support program" on Axelay, later left Konami to help found Treasure Co. Ltd. Kudo Taro primarily composed the game's soundtrack.

The game was re-released on the Nintendo [[Wii]]'s Virtual Console service in Australia and North America in 2007 and in Japan in 2008.

title: hikari_shinji
body: A fictional Japanese character from the [[Sei Juushi Bismarck]] science fiction and [[mecha]] series from the 80s.

title: tigersharks
body:
[b]TigerSharks[/b] is an American [[science fiction]] animated children's television series developed by Rankin/Bass and distributed by Lorimar-Telepictures in 1987. 

The series involved a team of heroes that could transform into humanoid sharks and other marine animals and resembled the previous series [[ThunderCats]] (1985) and [[SilverHawks]] (1986), also developed by Rankin/Bass.

TigerSharks lasted one season with 26 episodes and was part of "The Comic Strip" show, which consisted of four animated shorts: TigerSharks, Street Frogs, The Mini Monsters, and Karate Kat.

The animation is notable because it actually was provided by the Japanese company Pacific Animation Corporation and thus made in an 80s anime style. 

Warner Bros. Animation currently owns the series, as they own the 1974-89 Rankin/Bass library, which was incorporated into the merger of Lorimar-Telepictures and Warner Bros.

h4. Characters

* [[octavia_(tigersharks)|Octavia]]

body:

The company is best known for introducing Japan's first televisions, and developing the first VHS video recorder.

title: gradius_v
body:
[b]Gradius V[/b] (グラディウスV - [i]Gradiusu V[/i]) is a Japanese 2D [[science fiction]] shoot 'em up [[video game]] published by [[Konami]] for the [[Sony]] [[PlayStation 2]] video game console in 2004. It is part of the [[Gradius]] series.

Gradius V was largely developed under contract by [[Treasure]], who had previously worked on [[Radiant Silvergun]] and [[Ikaruga]]. 

It was re-released for PlayStation Network on April 15, 2015 in Japan and later in North-America and Europe in the same month.

title: kunio-kun
body:
A character and main protagonist from the [[Kunio-kun series]].

[b]Kunio-kun[/b] (くにおくん) is a tough, brave and honorable high school Japanese boy expert in martial arts and street fighting. He wears a traditional white high [[school uniform]] (or [[gakuran]]) and black shoes.

He first appeared in the [[Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-kun]] [[arcade]] [[video game]] from 1986.

Kunio-kun (variously renamed "Alex" and "Crash Cooney" in the United States), was named after Kunio Taki, the former president of "Technōs Japan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Techn%C5%8Ds_Japan , the company that created the first game in the series.

Kunio-kun also later became Technōs Japan's main mascot from 1990 until 1996, appearing on the company's logo in several games and in different Japanese television commercials.

title: x-2_shinshin
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi X-2 Shinshin[/b] (formerly known only as the [b]ATD-X[/b]) is a Japanese experimental fifth generation military aircraft created for testing advanced stealth [[fighter jet]] technologies. 

It is being developed by the Japanese Ministry of Defense Technical Research and Development Institute (TRDI) for research purposes. The main contractor of the project is Mitsubishi Heavy Industries. 

Many consider this combat aircraft to be Japan's first domestically made stealth fighter. ATD-X is an acronym meaning "Advanced Technology Demonstrator – X". The aircraft is widely known in [[Japan]] as [i]Shinshin[/i] (心神, meaning "Spirit of the Heart"), although the name itself is only an early codename within the Japan Self-Defense Forces and the name is not officially in use.
 
The ATD-X's first flight is scheduled for early 2016.

title: coyote_tango
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction series. It first appeared in the live action film from 2013.

[b]Coyote Tango[/b] is a Japanese Jaeger mecha.

title: cherno_alpha
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction series.

[b]Cherno Alpha[/b] is a very big and powerful Russian Jaeger mecha. It is piloted by [[Sasha Kaidanovsky]] and [[Aleksis Kaidanovsky]].

title: vva-14
body:
The [b]Bartini Beriev VVA-14[/b] ([i]Vertikal`no-Vzletayuschaya Amphibia[/i] or "Vertical Take-Off Amphibious [[Aircraft]]") is an experimental jet airplane that was developed in the [[Soviet]] Union during the early 70s. 

Designed to be able to take-off from the water and fly at high speed over long distances, it was to make true flights at high altitude, but also have the capability of 'flying' efficiently just above the sea surface, using ground effect. 

The VVA-14 was designed by Robert Bartini in answer to a perceived requirement to destroy United States Navy Polaris [[radiation symbol|nuclear]] [[missile]] [[submarine]]s.

After extensive research the first VVA-14 prototype was completed in 1972. Its first official flight was from a conventional runway on 4 September 1972.

After Bartini's death in 1974, the project slowed down and eventually drew to a close, with the last remaining prototype being sent to a Russian air museum in 1987.

title: eden_assassin
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction series.

[b]Eden Assassin[/b] is a Russian Jaeger mecha.

title: strobaya
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] series. He appears in the first videogame from 1989.

[b]Strobaya[/b] is a [[muscular]] bound Russian [[cyborg]] working for the Kazakh government. Also called an "Enhanced Human" (強化人間), his weapon is his entire body, whose functions have been considerably boosted by the administration of drugs. 

Strobaya's design is somewhat similar to Ivan Drago (the main antagonist from the film Rocky IV), with short military crew cut blonde hair, a huge muscular body, a red outfit and yellow boots. His main method of attack is grabbing his enemies with either his arms or legs to throw them violently against the opposing wall. He can either approach his enemies by impulsing himself off the ceiling with the strength of his legs, or by doing a ground Rolling Attack, his signature technique. 

Strobaya has a very repetitive offensive strategy. He also enjoys shouting warcries during battle.

title: su-57
body:
The [b]Sukhoi PAK FA[/b] (Russian: Сухой ПАК ФА, Russian: Перспективный авиационный комплекс фронтовой авиации, Perspektivny aviatsionny kompleks frontovoy aviatsii, literally "Prospective Airborne Complex of Frontline Aviation") is a twin-engine [[jet]] fighter being developed by Sukhoi for the Russian Air Force. 

The PAK FA is a fifth generation jet fighter that is intended to be the successor to the [[MiG-29]] and [[Su-27]] in the Russian inventory. It is considered [[Russia]]'s answer to the American [[F-22 Raptor]].

The first prototype, codenamed [b]T-50[/b], flew for the first time during the year 2010. 

The mass production version of the PAK FA will feature stealth technology and have the capability to supercruise. The jet will incorporate advanced avionics such as an Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) radar and an artificial intelligence system. The PAK FA is to be outfitted with the next generation of air-to-air, air-to-surface, and air-to-ship missiles.

On August 1, 2017 the PAK FA was given the designation Cy-57/[b]Su-57[/b].

title: mig-21
body:
The [b]Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21[/b] (Russian: Микоян и Гуревич МиГ-21; NATO reporting name [b]"Fishbed"[/b]) is a supersonic jet fighter aircraft, designed by the Mikoyan-Gurevich Design Bureau in the [[Soviet]] Union. 

It was popularly nicknamed "balalaika", from the aircraft's planform-view resemblance to the Russian stringed musical instrument or ołówek (English: pencil) by Polish pilots due to the shape of its fuselage. Early versions are considered second-generation jet fighters, while later versions are considered to be third-generation jet fighters. 

Some 50 countries over four continents have flown the MiG-21, and it still serves many nations a half-century after its maiden flight. The fighter made aviation records. 

At least by name, it is the most-produced supersonic jet aircraft in aviation history and the most-produced combat aircraft since the Korean War, and it had the longest production run of a combat aircraft from 1958 to 1985. 

The Fishbed is a delta-winged [[jet]] interceptor identifiable by nose air intake with protruding centerbody for radar, flush canopy with heavy bow frame, and empennage with single engine and stabilizer, ventral fin and raked tailplanes. Armament included one 30mm automatic [[cannon]], two air-to-air missiles or 2 bombs. Many are still in service with various air forces around the world.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "MiG-21":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikoyan-Gurevich_MiG-21
* Fas.org: "MiG-21/J-7 Fishbed":http://www.fas.org/man/dod-101/sys/ac/row/mig-21.htm
* Youtube: "MiG-21 video":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHH-YI6Rj7w&feature=related

title: su-47_berkut
body:
The [b]Sukhoi Su-47 Berkut[/b] (Russian: Су-47 Беркут - [i]Golden Eagle[/i]; NATO reporting name [i]Firkin[/i]), also designated S-32 and S-37 (not to be confused with the twin-engined delta canard design offered by Sukhoi in the early 1990s under the designation [[Su-37]]) during initial development, was an experimental supersonic [[jet]] fighter developed by Sukhoi Aviation Corporation. 

A distinguishing feature of the aircraft was its combination of forward-swept wings and [[canards]] that gave the aircraft excellent agility and maneuverability. While serial production of the type never materialized, the sole aircraft produced served as a technology demonstrator prototype for a number of advanced technologies later used in the 4.5 generation fighter [[Su-35]] BM and current fifth-generation jet fighter prototype Sukhoi [[su-57|PAK FA]].

title: su-27
body:
The [B]Sukhoi Su-27[/B] (Russian: Сухой Су-27) (NATO reporting name: [i]Flanker[/i]) is a twin-engine super-maneuverable fighter [[jet]] designed by Sukhoi. 

It was intended as a direct competitor for the large United States fourth generation fighters, with 3,530-kilometre (1,910 nmi) range, heavy armament, sophisticated avionics and high maneuverability. 

The Su-27 most often flies air superiority missions, but is able to perform almost all combat operations. Complementing the smaller [[MiG-29]], the Su-27's closest US counterpart is the [[F-15 Eagle]].

There are several related developments of the Su-27 design. The Su-30 is a two-seat, dual-role fighter for all-weather, air-to-air and air-to-surface deep interdiction missions. The [[Su-33]] ‘Flanker-D’ is a navy fleet defense interceptor for use on aircraft carriers. Further versions include the side-by-side 2-seat Su-34 ‘Fullback’ strike variant and the [[Su-35]] ‘Flanker-E’ improved air defense fighter.

title: super_contra
body:
[b][i]Super Contra[/i][/b] (スーパー魂斗羅 エイリアンの逆襲 Sūpā Kontora: Eirian no Gyakushū, [i]"Super Contra: The Alien Strikes Back"[/i]) is a [[military]] science fiction shooter [[video game]] produced by [[Konami]], originally released as a coin-operated arcade game in 1988. 

It is the sequel to the original [[Contra]] and the second game in the [i]Contra[/i] series released for the [[arcade]]s. 

Like in the original game, the game centers on soldiers [[Bill Rizer]] and [[Lance Bean]], who are once again assigned to protect the Earth from an army of [[alien]] invaders. The game features standard side-scrolling stages, as well as all new overhead stages in lieu of the original game's "3D" stages.

Like its predecessor, a modified console version was made for the Nintendo Entertainment System, which saw release in North America as [i][b]Super C[/b][/i] and in Europe and Australia as [b][i]Probotector II: Return of the Evil Forces[/i][/b]. 

Because of their popularity, both the arcade game and the [[NES]] game have been re-released in various other platforms since their original releases.

title: yf-30
body:

The [b]YF-30 Chronos[/b] is a very advanced experimental variable fighter deployed by the [[S.M.S.]] 

It first appeared in the [[Macross 30]] [[video game]] released for the [[Playstation 3]] home console only in Japan during 2013.

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] exclusively for the game.

[b]Lucia[/b] is a female combat [[android]] who helps the protagonist [[Bill Rizer]] during his missions.

She appears in the games [[Contra: Shattered Soldier]] and [[Neo Contra]] released for the [[Playstation 2]]. Lucia later appeared in the [[Contra Dual Spirits]] [[Nintendo DS]] portable game from 2008 as a bonus playable character.

title: tornado_pack
body:
A fictional type of [[mecha]] equipment from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction series.

The [b]Tornado Pack[/b] is a special weapon pack created for the [[VF-25]] [[variable fighter]] that has a multi-directional turret with two powerful beam cannons as well as additional armor and thrusters in it.

It first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier: Itsuwari No Utahime]] animated movie from 2009.

In real life it was designed by artist and series creator [[Kawamori Shouji]]. The Tornado Pack was inspired by an early design Kawamori created for the original [[VF-1]] mecha from [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|the first Macross TV series]] from the 80s, but that was never used back then.

It is an evolution of the (now) old and highly successful [[Valken]] assault suit, now able to be equipped with several new types of energy and ballistic [[gunpod|modular weapons]], defensive systems and mobility units.

A giant [[alien]] [[monster]] from the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. It first appeared in the original comics from the mid 80s.

[b]Laya[/b] is a creature made of pure energy that feeds on the power of cybernetic organisms. It can become solid and reproduce limbs, parts and components from the [[robot]]s it has drained its energy from. 

Because of its nature the alien being is a dangerous enemy of the Stellar Warriors and [[Karmatron]].

title: glavil
body:
An [[alien]] creature from the [[Macross 7]] science fiction series from the 90s.

[b]Glavil[/b] (グラビル [i]Gurabiru[/i]) is a giant, muscular [[Protodeviln]] monster with tentacles on its back and is usually perched on all fours like an animal. He represents pure, untamed fury, crushing everything in his path, and generating enormous energy fields which rip apart all around him. 

Glavil can also fire intense energy beams that surpass by far the Macross Cannon in power. His face can also redirect laser fire. He increases in size when he absorbs spiritia, which he can drain from lower life forms such as humans and [[Zentradi]] and even cause massive dehydration, but the energy of Anima Spiritia causes him to shrink, and after several encounters he flees instinctively from it. 

Lacking any discernible intelligence of his own, he is frequently given instructions by [[Gavil]], the other half of an even more powerful being.

The [b]miclonization chamber[/b] is a sophisticated device that uses "super-dimension" (hyperspace) energy that allows the [[alien]] [[Zentradi]] "[[maclone]]" [[giant]]s to reduce their sizes to human levels. The technology on which these devices are based was created by the advanced [[Protoculture]] and has been long lost since milenia ago.

title: louise_oberon
body:
A main character from the [[Tokusou Kihei Dorvack]] science fiction anime TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Louise Oberon[/b] is a human [[mecha]] pilot who fights to protect the Earth. Louise pilots the VH-64 MR [[Oberon Gazzette]], a type of transforming [[helicopter]] mecha.

She is a very brave but sweet and tender character.

title: gauna
body:
A fictional race of morphing and shape-shifting [[giant]] [[alien]] creatures from the [[Sidonia No Kishi]] science fiction [[mecha]] series. They are the main antagonists in the series.

[[Nihei Tsutomu]]'s previous work [[Abara]] used the term "Gauna" to refer to humans with the ability to extrude armor from their skeletons.

h4. See also

* [[Benisuzume (Gauna)]]
* [[Shiraui Tsumugi]]

A fictional type of assassin [[android]] [[robot]] that appears in the [[Snatcher]] [[cyberpunk]] science fiction [[video game]] from the 80s.

It's very similar to the [[T-800]] robot from the the [[Terminator (series)|]] series and was inspired by it.

However, the Snatcher also has a powerful energy cannon inside its mouth.

title: cylon
body:
A fictional [[robot]] race from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction TV series.

The [b]Cylons[/b] are bent on the destruction of their former masters, the human race.

In the reimagined series universe, the term "Cylon" stands for [b]CY[/b]bernetic [b]L[/b]ifef[b]O[/b]rm [b]N[/b]ode.

h4.See also

* [[Raider (spacecraft)]]
* [[Cylon Centurion]]
* [[Basestar]]

title: crystal_kane
body: A fictional female character from the [[Centurions: Power Xtreme]] science fiction cartoon from 1986.

title: cylon_centurion
body:
A fictional [[robot]] [[soldier]] from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction TV series.

The [b]Cylon Centurion[/b] is the most basic [[Cylon]] soldier unit. It is heavy armored, very strong and resilient, although slow and not very smart. However, they are also armed with long range weapons and their perfect accuracy makes them dangerous enemies.

They are usually deployed in vast numbers and always tend to overwhelm their opponents rapidly and with deadly precision. 

The centurions also have swords and concealed blades in their forearms for close quarters combat against the human colonists.

One of their most distinctive characteristics is a bright red sensor "eye" which constantly oscilates from side to side and stops when a lock on its target is achieved.

title: copper_kidd
body:
A fictional [[alien]] character from the [[Silverhawks]] science fiction cartoon from 1986.

The [b]Copper Kidd[/b] is a young law enforcer [[cyborg]] who, like the rest of his team, has energy eagle wings and can shoot lasers from his shoulders.

He is the only alien in the Silverhawks team. As his name indicates, his armor is colored in a shade of copper.

title: steelheart

[[Steelwill]] is her brother.

title: morito_(sidonia_no_kishi)
body:
(もりと, "Garde" or "Guardian")

A series of fictional manned combat [[mecha]] from the [[Sidonia No Kishi]] science fiction series. In the story they are mainly used to fight the [[Gauna]] [[alien]] [[monster]]s. It has "a function":[http://sidonia-no-kishi.wikia.com/wiki/Clasp_Formation] to increase speed output by [[holding hands]] each other.

[[sidonia_(ship)|Spaceship Sidonia's]] major production type at the story's start is Kunato Developments' "Ichihachi-shiki Morito" / Type 18 [One-Eight] Garde, and its power source is the Heigus/Hyggs engine.


h4. See also

* [[Kabizashi]]
* [[Tsugumori]]

title: kayus
body:
Main protagonist of the [[Dragon Breed]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] arcade video game produced by [[Irem]] in 1989.

[b]King Kayus[/b] is the intrepid, brave and mature-beyond-his-years 15 years old new king of the Agamen Empire. 

He fights to save his world from the biomechanical mounstocities released when opposers of his enthronement conspired to break the seal confining the ancient King of Darkness, Zambaquous, to seize the kingdom with black power. Thus, wind was filled with miasma and the ground rotted, gradually turning Kayus' world into a land of dark monsters. 

The valiant Kayus arms himself with his combat armor and energy crossbow. He then invokes the help of the "[[Dragon]] of Light", [[Bahamoot]], to help him in his quest to defeat the darkness.

The [b]VF-2JA Icarus[/b] is a heavy armed, maneuverable and fast variable fighter optimized for atmospheric operations. It has [[canards]] and is armed with [[missile]]s and several energy weapons.

title: macross_the_ride
body:
[b]Macross The Ride[/b] (マクロス・ザ・ライド - [i]Makurosu Za Raido[/i]) or [b]Macross R[/b] (マクロス R - [i]Makurosu R[/i]) is a light novel series published in the Dengeki Hobby Magazine, a Japanese model kit magazine. It is based on the [[Macross]] science fiction [[mecha]] series. It was serialized from December 2010 until November 2011.

The novel series was written by Kodachi Ukyō and illustrated by [[Tenjin Hidetaka]], Enami Katsumi and Otsuka Tommy. 

The plot is set in an air race competition performed using advanced civilian "valkyries" (variable fighters) in the massive space emigration colony ship [[Macross Frontier]] in the year 2058 A.D., one year before the events of the titular anime TV series. Many designs from the different Macross series also appear in this novel.
